reviewText: The world we live has many points of interest.This tells of some of them.Very good movie.
Title: Ancient Mysteries - Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

reviewText: "Seven Wonders of the Ancient World" is an A & E studios video about the original ancient seven mysteries: the pyramids of Giza, the hanging gardens of Babylon, the colossus of Rhodes, the temple of Artemis at Ephesus, the mausoleum of Halicamassus, statue of Zeus at Olympia, and the lighthouse at Alexandria.  Leonard Nimoy narrates this video, and although dry in spots, for the most part you won't fall asleep in the hour and forty minute long documentary's delivery.  There are many points of information I hadn't heard before (or if I did, I had forgotten).  Each of these seven topics could have their own documentary, and it is nice they are all reduced into short enough segments that it makes this video focus on the more interesting details and then move on.  Some footage is modern day sites of the ruins where these wonders used to be, some footage is artwork or reenactments, and some video is interviews with scholars who share what research has revealed regarding some of the seven wonders of the ancient world.  All in all, of this type of DVD on this topic, this has been one of the better ones I've seen in a very long time.  It helps I suppose that I like Leonard Nimoy, but the documentary actually is well done.
summary: One of the better documentaries on this subject . . . .
Title: Ancient Mysteries - Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

reviewText: Content is very good, and well organized.  I did get the item on time.
Title: Ancient Mysteries - Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

reviewText: I have always been interested in the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, but of course, except for the pyramids, I regretted that I would never see them.  This documentary does a good job of evoking those long-lost sites through various graphic arts, and I enjoyed learning things I would not otherwise have known, i.e. the Colossus could not possibly have straddled the strait and that a rodent infestation that rustled scared Caligula's thieves from stealing the statue of Zeus! I am glad I own it, as I will likely watch it again.
Title: Ancient Mysteries - Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

reviewText: I learned a lot from this DVD - its a tad dated but really not too bad. I was hoping for more on the Colliseum and other world wonders
Title: Ancient Mysteries - Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
